stories.title: China bans Tesla cars for 2 month during party leadership meet
Lego embraces modularity, metaverse with its software engineering culture
Billion-record stolen Chinese database for sale on breach forum

stories.text:
I consider HN to be pretty much my "home" on the internet. In spite of all its flaws, I find interesting news here and generally thoughtful and intelligent discussions.

Now, after becoming a father I have felt a stronger desire to move towards doing something for the climate. I am not making that transition now, but I have started a "background thread" that researches potential fields that I can explore.

One such field that I find interesting is refrigeration tech. There is a subreddit for this, but it's not very active and I am wondering if there are other communities where I can start to just listen in on discussions to start getting familiar with the area. Does anyone have a suggestion as to where to go?
stories.title: Ask HN: Community for Engineering (Not Software)?
